tool.name: Volumetric_Change_Detection

param.name: before
param.datatype: File or LAS Dataset or LAS Dataset Layer
param.dialogReference: The earlier LiDAR scan to be compared as baseline.
param.pythonReference: The earlier LiDAR scan to be compared as baseline.

param.name: after
param.datatype: File or LAS Dataset or LAS Dataset Layer
param.dialogReference: The later LiDAR scan, of which new features and ground changes will be highlighted.
param.pythonReference: The later LiDAR scan, of which new features and ground changes will be highlighted.

param.name: spacing
param.dialogReference: Size of interval for skipping and analyzing points. In units of base data.
param.pythonReference: Size of interval for skipping and analyzing points. In units of base data.

param.name: groundheight
param.dialogReference: Average height of ground for classifying ground and non-ground features and changes. In units of the base data.
param.pythonReference: Average height of ground for classifying ground and non-ground features and changes. In units of the base data.

param.name: resolution
param.dialogReference: The size of the "window" for searching for change features. In units of the base data.
param.pythonReference: The size of the "window" for searching for change features. In units of the base data.

param.name: verbose
param.dialogReference: More or less details output to console.
param.pythonReference: More or less details output to console.

param.name: min_points
param.dialogReference: Minimum number of points to be considered a cluster.
param.pythonReference: Minimum number of points to be considered a cluster

param.name: cluster_tolerance
param.dialogReference: Maximum Euclidean distance for a point to be added to the cluster. In units of base data.
param.pythonReference: Maximum Euclidean distance for a point to be added to the cluster. In units of base data.

tool.summary: Volumetric Change Detection was authored by Brad Chambers, Howard Butler, and Ogynan Moore as an algorithm to compare a before and after LiDAR scan and output rasters, point clouds, and meshes that highlight difference areas, classified as ground and non-ground.
